p: Epidemiological states were compartmentalised based on present influenza season vaccine status (indexed by N for non-vaccinated or V for vaccinated). We obtained weekly time-varying vaccine uptake rates, ν, at the population level by computing a weighted average of the individual age group uptake values, thereby accounting for the population distribution in each given influenza season. We assumed the rate of vaccination ν to be constant over each weekly period. Vaccine efficacy depended upon the extent to which the strains in the vaccine matched the circulating strain in that influenza season ( Table 1).
